instructions:
Write a function that returns the number of distinct items inside a box. Do not count items outside the box.

Examples

count([
  "??????",
  "?####?",
  "?#&!#?",
  "@#^Z#?",
  "$####?"
]) ➞ 4

count([
  "??????",
  "?####?",
  "?#ZZ#?",
  "@#ZZ#?",
  "$####?",
  "AAAAAA"
]) ➞ 1

count([
  "AAAAA",
  "AAA##",
  "AAA##",
  "AAAAA",
  "AAAAA"
]) ➞ 0

Notes

Return 0 if the box is empty or too small to fit anything.
tests:
Test.assertEquals(count(
["??????",
"?####?",
"?#&!#?",
"@#^Z#?",
"$####?"]), 4)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["??????",
"?####?",
"?#ZZ#?",
"@#ZZ#?",
"$####?", 
"AAAAAA"]), 1)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["??????",
"?####?",
"?#  #?",
"@#  #?",
"$####?", 
"AAAAAA"]), 0)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["??????Z",
"Z?####?V",
"$?#  #?X",
"$@#BA#?P",
"$T####?T", 
"ZAAAAAAT"]), 2)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["??????Z",
"Z?####?V",
"$?#BB#?X",
"$@#BA#?P",
"$T####?T", 
"ZAAAAAAT"]), 2)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["!!Z",
"###",
"#B#",
"#B#",
"###"]), 1)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["!!Z",
"###",
"#B#",
"# #",
"###"]), 1)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["AAAAA",
"AAA##",
"AAA##",
"AAAAA",
"AAAAA"]), 0)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["AAAAAAA",
"AAA###A",
"AAA#!#A",
"AAA###A",
"AAAAAAA"]), 1)

Test.assertEquals(count(
["#AAAAAABC",
"AAA#####C",
"ZAA#!%@#C",
"AAA#####C",
"#AAAAAABC"]), 3)
title: Inside, not Outside a Box
